title: Are stupid people more dangerous than smart people? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely. In the grander scheme of things, malevolent people who are also smart are probably more dangerous. If someone’s aggressive and stupid, then they will probably be quite straightforward in their aggression. They may try to hurt you physically, rob you, bully you, scare you, destroy your property, et cetera. If they are smart, however, they may be more cunning in their aggression (narcissistic, sociopathic, psychopathic types). They may use their social pull and power to turn people against you, manipulate you and others, get you fired, destroy your career and family, poison you, take away your children, and so on. A lot of these types get into positions of power (policemen, politicians, doctors, psychologists, and so on.), which makes them more dangerous because they have power over others who are often in some ways dependent on them. It’s much easier to protect yourself from some angry, straightforward person.

Yes. From my own experience, I have seen many times that people unhindered and unburdened by intelligence are far more likely to not hesitate to strike first, and decisively, in a toe to toe confrontation. In a combat situation, you had better believe that he who overthinks is more likely to die with the same expression on his face that he had as he paused, to think about the situation… than the guy who doesn’t think. As hard as it may be to believe, there are situations, of which this is only one, where your intelligence can be more of a liability than an asset.
